original_title: Walmart is raising prices because of tariffs. Customers are still flocking to Walmart | CNN Business
article_summary: Walmart's sales at US stores increased by 4.8% in Q3 2025, with growth led by upper-income households. Despite tariff-induced cost increases, the retail giant is maintaining low prices to attract customers. Walmart's strength in groceries and essentials, as well as its economies of scale, help it dominate the industry and outperform rivals like Target, which is struggling with slumping sales and a CEO stepping down.</s>
